channel.title: A client bug?
channel.description: Hello moparscape users, A mate and I are coding a rsps, he made a webclient, It works good but there is one bug. Whenever I load the webclient the username and the password are already filt in with a name and pass, so everyone can log in on that account. The question is:How can we make the client forget the username and pass whenever you load or restart the client? We aren't pro coders so a bit of explaining is welcome. -Wartek

item.title: A client bug?
item.dc:creator: @wartek wartek
item.description:
@wartek wrote:

I did that, afterwards the problem was solved, but another occured.
You couldn’t write your name into the username or passwordbox…

Read full topic

item.title: A client bug?
item.dc:creator: @imstrength imstrength
item.description:
@imstrength wrote:

[quote=“wartek, post:1, topic:468521”]Hello moparscape users,
A mate and I are coding a rsps, he made a webclient, It works good but there is one bug.
Whenever I load the webclient the username and the password are already filt in with a name and pass, so everyone can log in on that account.
The question is:How can we make the client forget the username and pass whenever you load or restart the client?
We aren’t pro coders so a bit of explaining is welcome.
-Wartek[/quote]

easy fix just open your client folder and search for the username and pass that are on it when opened… then all you have to do is delete them and re-jar and upload the client to fix the webclient

Read full topic

item.title: A client bug?
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

Team_Rocket:

Your Client has a feature which remembers the last User’s details. Have you tried running a simple search for “username” in your Client class? There are also Tutorials on how this is done. You can use these as examples on exactly how it can be removed.

rocket i want your rocket in mae ass plz?

Read full topic

item.title: A client bug?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Your Client has a feature which remembers the last User’s details. Have you tried running a simple search for “username” in your Client class? There are also Tutorials on how this is done. You can use these as examples on exactly how it can be removed.

Hello moparscape users,
A mate and I are coding a rsps, he made a webclient, It works good but there is one bug.
Whenever I load the webclient the username and the password are already filt in with a name and pass, so everyone can log in on that account.
The question is:How can we make the client forget the username and pass whenever you load or restart the client?
We aren’t pro coders so a bit of explaining is welcome.
